result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony Miller

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tony Miller appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Tony Miller.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status conference.  
Case is in trial posture, defense counsel requests case be placed on the trial calendar.  Any pretrial motions to be filed by the final pretrial date. 
Case adjourned to Branch 30.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Tony Miller appeared by video.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Tony Miller. Attorney M. Samir Siddique appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review. 
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services STATUS Report, filed.

Defendant Tony Miller in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tony Miller appeared by video means with Attorney. Victim KT appears by video means.
Case in court for status conference. Defense counsel has not received a discovery and offer from the State and requests an adjourned status date to determine case posture.
Case adjourned to Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Tony Miller in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tony Miller appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Victim KLT appears via Zoom. Court ordered JusticePoint LEVEL 4 supervision to be REINSTATED. Defense in receipt of discovery and no offer.
Case adjourned.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services DISCHARGE Report received and filed.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and forwarded to Judge for review.  bm
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

02:54 PM Defendant Tony Miller in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Tony Miller in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Defense motion to dismiss count 3. State argues, court DENIED motion.Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Tony Miller not in court.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. Court makes a finding that there is a possible victim identified and stays the forfeiture order with restitution to be determined at close of case.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/23/2022@2:30p
